name: eruditis-atlassian
description: Connect Claude to Eruditis Confluence and Jira via sooperset/mcp-atlassian running in a sandboxed Docker container with network egress filtering. Read-only by default.
long_description: This extension runs the mcp-atlassian MCP server inside a Docker container with network egress filtering (can ONLY connect to Atlassian domains), no filesystem mounts, and no host network access. An automatic filtering proxy prevents data exfiltration to arbitrary endpoints. Your API token is stored encrypted in your OS keychain. By default, only read operations and page create/update are enabled. Destructive operations (delete) are never exposed.

atlassian_url.title: Atlassian Site URL
atlassian_url.description: Your Atlassian Cloud URL, e.g. https://eruditis.atlassian.net (no trailing slash)

atlassian_email.title: Atlassian Email
atlassian_email.description: The email address you use to log into Atlassian (your Gmail)

atlassian_api_token.title: Atlassian API Token
atlassian_api_token.description: Generate at https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/security/api-tokens â€” click 'Create API token', copy it, paste here

enable_write_tools.title: Enable Write Operations
enable_write_tools.description: Set to 'true' to enable create/update operations. Leave empty or 'false' for read-only mode.

confluence_spaces_filter.title: Confluence Spaces Filter
confluence_spaces_filter.description: Comma-separated space keys to restrict access (e.g. 'DEV,TEAM,DOC'). Leave empty for all spaces.

jira_projects_filter.title: Jira Projects Filter
jira_projects_filter.description: Comma-separated project keys to restrict access (e.g. 'PROJ,DEV'). Leave empty for all projects.
